member.remarks: The size of the PositionedNode visible representation Polygons depends on the camera's Z position - as the Camera moves further away, the Polygons are drawn larger. member.name: M:FlatRedBall.AI.Pathfinding.NodeNetwork.GetPath(FlatRedBall.AI.Pathfinding.PositionedNode,FlatRedBall.AI.Pathfinding.PositionedNode)
member.summary: Returns the List of PositionedNodes which make the path from the start PositionedNode to the end PositionedNode.
member.remarks: If start and end are the same node then the List returned will contain that node.
member.param: The PositionedNode to begin the path at.
The destination PositionedNode.
member.returns: The list of nodes to travel through to reach the end PositionedNode from the start PositionedNode. The start and end nodes are included in the returned List.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.AI.Pathfinding.NodeNetwork.GetPath(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector3@,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector3@)
member.summary: Returns the List of PositionedNodes which make the path from the start Vector3 to the end Vector3.
member.remarks: This method finds the closest nodes to each of the arguments, then calls the overload for GetPath which takes PositionedNode arguments.
member.param: The world-coordinate start position.
The world-coordinate end position.
member.returns: The list of nodes to travel through to reach the closest PositionedNode to the endPoint from the closest PositionedNode to the startPoint.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.AI.Pathfinding.NodeNetwork.GetPathOrClosest(FlatRedBall.AI.Pathfinding.PositionedNode,FlatRedBall.AI.Pathfinding.PositionedNode)
member.summary: Returns the List of PositionedNodes which make the path from the start PositionedNode to the end PositionedNode, or the node closest to the end node which is linked through the network to the start PositionedNode.
member.remarks: If start and end are the same node then the List returned will contain that node.
member.param: The PositionedNode to begin the path at.
The optimal destination PositionedNode.
member.returns: The list of nodes to travel through to reach the end PositionedNode, or the node closest to the PositionedNode which is connected to the start PositionedNode, from the start PositionedNode. The start and end nodes are included in the returned List.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.AI.Pathfinding.NodeNetwork.GetPathOrClosest(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector3@,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector3@)
member.summary: Returns the List of PositionedNodes which make the path from the start Vector3 to the end Vector3, or to the node closest to the end Vector3 available if the end node is not linked in some way to the start node.
member.remarks: This method finds the closest nodes to each of the arguments, then calls the overload for GetPathOrClosest which takes PositionedNode arguments.
member.param: The world-coordinate start position.
The world-coordinate end position.
member.returns: The list of nodes to travel through to reach the closest PositionedNode which is linked to the closest PositionedNode to the startPoint.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.AI.Pathfinding.NodeNetwork.GetCollisionOptimizedPath(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector3,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector3,FlatRedBall.Math.PositionedObjectList{FlatRedBall.Math.Geometry.Polygon})
member.summary: Returns a List of Vector3s that will be an optimized version of GetPath given the NodeNetwork and a Collision Map to test against.
member.remarks:
This method will get the optimal path between the two vectors using GetPath, and then will optimize it by testing line of sight between the nodes to see if the path can be optimized further (for more optimized pathfinding). When optimizing the path between two nodes, it will check if the midpoint is in line of sight with the startingPosition, and if it is, change the path to the midpoint instead of the current target node. the numberOfOptimizations decides how many times it will take the midpoint and optimize further.
This method assumes that the node network does NOT fall within collidable objects.
member.param: The world-coordinate of the starting position.
The world-coordinate of the destination.
The collision map which will have the obstacles you are trying to path around.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.AI.Pathfinding.NodeNetwork.GetCollisionOptimizedPath(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector3,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector3,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Single,FlatRedBall.Math.PositionedObjectList{FlatRedBall.Math.Geometry.Polygon})
member.summary: Returns a List of Vector3s that will be an optimized version of GetPath given the NodeNetwork and a Collision Map to test against.
member.remarks: This method will get the optimal path between the two vectors using GetPath, and then will optimize it by testing line of sight between the nodes to see if the path can be optimized further (for more optimized pathfinding). When optimizing the path between two nodes, it will check if the midpoint is in line of sight with the startingPosition, and if it is, change the path to the midpoint instead of the current target node. the numberOfOptimizations decides how many times it will take the midpoint and optimize further.
member.param: The world-coordinate of the starting position.
The world-coordinate of the destination.
The number of times the algorithm will take the midpoint between two nodes to test if they are within line of sight of each other (higher means nearer to optimal path).
Usually the object using the path will be larger than 0, use the size of the collision for testing line of sight.
The collision map which will have the obstacles you are trying to path around.

member.summary: Tests if two vector positions are within line of sight given a collision map.

member.summary: Calculates the closest visible point to outOfSightPosition given the currentPosition.

member.summary: An object which has position properties

member.summary: The node that links to this node. This is reset every time the containing NodeNetwork searches for a path.

members.member:
Only active nodes are included in pathfinding and find node searches.
Update February 10, 2013 Nodes should always start out as active.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.AI.Pathfinding.PositionedNode.CostToGetHere
member.summary: Returns the cost to get to this node from the start node. This value is only accurate if the node is contained in list returned by the last call to NodeNetwork.GetPath.
member.remarks: This value is reset anytime GetPath is called on the containing NodeNetwork.

member.summary: The Node's name. Mainly used for saving NodeNetworks since saved Links reference PositionedNodes by name.

member.summary: The X position of the PositionedNode.

member.summary: The Y position of the PositionedNode.

member.summary: The Z position of the PositionedNode.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.AI.Pathfinding.PositionedNode.Links
member.summary: The links belonging to this PositionedNode.
member.remarks:
This is a list of Links which reference the PositionedNodes that this links to. Links are one-way and PositionedNodes that this links to do not necessarily contain Links back to this.
This list is provided for advanced scenarios, such as when when adding a subclassed Link. Otherwise use functions like LinkTo and LinkToOneWay

member.summary: Creates Links from this to the argument nodeToLinkTo, and another Link from the argument nodeToLinkTo back to this.
member.remarks: If either this or the argument nodeToLinkTo already contains a link to the other PositionedNode, then the cost of the link is set to the argument costTo or costFrom as appropriate.
member.param: The other PositionedNode to create the Links between.
The cost to travel from this to the argument nodeToLinkTo.
The cost to travel from the nodeToLinkTo back to this.

member.name: T:FlatRedBall.AI.Pathfinding.TileNodeNetwork
member.summary: A node network optimized for tile-based pathfinding.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.AI.Pathfinding.TileNodeNetwork.#ctor(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Int32,System.Int32,FlatRedBall.AI.Pathfinding.DirectionalType)
member.summary: Creates a new, empty TileNodeNetwork matching the arguments.
member.param: The X position of the left-most nodes. This, along with the ySeed, define the bottom-left of the node network. For tile maps this should be the center X of the first tile column (typically TileWidth / 2).

The y position of the bottom-most nodes. This, along with xSeed, define the bottom-left of the node network. For tile maps this should be the center Y of the bottom tile row. If the top-left of the map is at 0,0, then this value would be (-EntireMapHeight + TileHeight/2)
The X and Y distance between each node. That is, the X distance between two adjacent nodes (assumed to be equal to the Y distance). For a tile map this will equal the width of a tile.
The number of nodes vertically.
The number of nodes horizontally.
Whether to create a Four-way or Eight-way node network. Eight creates diagonal links, enabling diagonal movement when following the node network.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.AI.Pathfinding.TileNodeNetwork.AddAndLinkTiledNodeWorld(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Adds a new node at the world X and Y location. Internally the world coordinates are converted to x,y indexes and the node is stored in a 2D grid.
member.param: The world X units.
The world Y units.
member.returns: The newly-created PositionedNode

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.AI.Pathfinding.TileNodeNetwork.AddAndLinkTiledNode(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Adds a new node at the tile index x, y.
member.param: The x index of the tile.
The y index of the tile.
member.returns: The newly-created PositionedNode

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.AI.Pathfinding.TileNodeNetwork.AddAndLinkTiledNode(System.Int32,System.Int32,FlatRedBall.AI.Pathfinding.DirectionalType)
member.summary: Creates a new node at index x, y and links the node to adjacent nodes given the TileNodeNetwork's GridSpacing
member.param: The X index
The Y index
The DirectionalType, which is either Four or Eight way. Four will link in cardinal directions, while Eight will also link diagonally.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.AI.Pathfinding.TileNodeNetwork.AddNode(FlatRedBall.AI.Pathfinding.PositionedNode)
member.summary: Adds an already-positioned node to the node network.
member.remarks: This method adds a node to the base nodes list, as well as to the 2D array of node. The position of the node is used to add the node, so it should already be in its final position prior to calling this method.
member.param: The node to add.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.AI.Pathfinding.TileNodeNetwork.FillCompletely
member.summary: Populates every possible space on the grid with a node and creates links betwen adjacent links. Diagonal links are created only if the DirectionalType is set to DirectionalType.Eight.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.AI.Pathfinding.TileNodeNetwork.RemoveNodesOverlapping(FlatRedBall.Math.Geometry.AxisAlignedRectangle)
member.summary: Removes all nodes which overlap the argument AxisAlignedRectangle. Note that the overlap check tests the entire cell of the TileNodeNetwork rather than strict overlap. Therefore, nodes may be removed even though the Position of the node is not inside of the rectangle.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.AI.Pathfinding.TileNodeNetwork.AttachNodeToNodeAtIndex(FlatRedBall.AI.Pathfinding.PositionedNode,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Attaches the argument node to the node at the index x,y. If the node at x,y is null or if the node is already linked, this operation does not perform any logic.
member.param: The node to link to the node at x,y
The x index of the taget node.
The y index of the target node.

member.name: T:FlatRedBall.Attributes.ExternalInstance
member.summary: Defines a member as an external instance. Members which are external instances are not read by ContentReaders. Rather they're set by ExternalInstances of referenced content such as Texture2Ds.

member.name: T:FlatRedBall.Attributes.ExternalInstanceList
member.summary: Attribute marking a member in a save class as an external instance. That is, it should be treated as external content by the ObjectReaders and ObjectWriters in the FlatRedBall content pipeline.

member.name: T:FlatRedBall.Attributes.InstanceListMember
member.summary: Used internally by the engine to determine the order of reading and writing for instances.

member.name: T:FlatRedBall.Attributes.InstanceMember
member.summary: Matches the marked member with the member to set when this instance is loaded through the content pipeline. This attribute is usually applied to ExternalReference objects.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Audio.AudioManager.MasterSoundVolume
member.summary: The default volume for playing sounds, applied when calling Play(SoundEffect). Ranges between 0 and 1.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Audio.AudioManager.MasterSongVolume
member.summary: The default volume for playing songs, applied when calling Play(Song). Ranges between 0 and 1.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Audio.AudioManager.AreSoundEffectsEnabled
member.summary: Controls whether the Play function will produce any audio when called. This defaults to true, and it can be set to false in response to a setting in the game's options screen. Setting this to false will not stop any currently-playing SoundEffects as this is an XNA limitation - SoundEffect is fire-and-forget.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Audio.AudioManager.CurrentSong
member.summary: Represents the "active" song. This may or may not be actually playing. This may still be non-null when no song is playing if the code has stopped music from playing. The AudioManager remembers this to resume playing later.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Audio.AudioManager.CurrentlyPlayingSong
member.summary: Represents the song that is currently playing. If no song is playing this is null.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Audio.AudioManager.CurrentlyPlayingISong
member.summary: Represents the song that is currently playing. If no song is playing this is null.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Audio.AudioManager.PlaySong
member.summary: Plays the current song. PlaySong with an argument must be called before this can be called. This can be used to resume music when the game is unpaused or if audio options are being turned on/off

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Audio.AudioManager.PlaySong(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Media.Song,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Plays the argument song, optionally restarting it if it is already playing.
member.param: The song to play.

Whether the song should be restarted. If the toPlay parameter differs from the currently-playing song then it will restart regardless of the forceRestart value. This value only matters when the currently-playing song is passed.

Whether the song uses a Global content manager. This is important if StopAndDisposeCurrentSongIfNameDiffers is called. StopAndDisposeCurrentSongIfNameDiffers is called by Glue, so the isSongGlobalContent param matters even if your code is not directly calling this function.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Audio.AudioManager.StopSong
member.summary: Stops the current song (either XNA or ISong) and sets the currently playing song to null. This does not clear the CurrentSong/CurrentISong properties, so PlaySong can be called to resume the same song.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Audio.AudioManager.IsSoundEffectPlaying(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Audio.SoundEffect)
member.summary: Returns whether the argument SoundEffect is playing. If true, then the SoundEffect is already playing. If false, the SoundEffect is not playing. This will only check SoundEffects which were played through the AudioManager.Play method.
member.param: The SoundEffect to test.
member.returns: Whether the sound effect is playing.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Audio.AudioManager.Play(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Audio.SoundEffect)
member.summary: Plays the argument sound effect using a default Volume, pitch, and pan.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Audio.AudioManager.Play(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Audio.SoundEffect,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Plays the argument sound effect.
member.param: The sound effect to play
Volume, ranging from 0.0f (silence) to 1.0f (full volume). 1.0f is full volume
Pitch, ranging from -1.0f (one octave down) to 1.0f (one octave up). 0.0f means no change
Volume, ranging from -1.0f (full left) to 1.0f (full right). 0.0f is centered

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Audio.AudioManager.PlayIfNotPlaying(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Audio.SoundEffect)

member.name: F:FlatRedBall.Camera.UpVector
member.summary: A Vector3 representing the "Up" orientation. The camera will adjust its rotation so that this vector is up. This enables 3D games (such as first person shooters) to rotate the camera yet still have a natural-feeling up vector.

member.name: F:FlatRedBall.Camera.mLightingEnabled
member.summary: Whether or not lighting is enabled for this camera

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Camera.ShouldRestrictViewportToResolution
member.summary: Sets whether the Camera will prevent viewports from being larger than the resolution. This value defaults to true.
member.remarks: The purpose of this value is to prevent cameras from attempting to draw outside of the window's client bounds. A camera which has a viewport larger than the window client bounds will throw an exception. However, cameras (and layers) which render to a render target which is larger than the current window should be able to render to the full render target even if it is larger than the current window. Therefore, this value should be set to false if rendering to large render targets.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Camera.FieldOfView
member.summary: The Y field of view of the camera in radians. Field of view represents the Y angle from the bottom of the screen to the top.
member.remarks: This modifies the xEdge and yEdge properties. Default value is (float)Math.PI / 4.0f;

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Camera.Layer

member.remarks: This instance is automatically created when the Camera is instantiated.

member.summary: Gets and sets the top side of the destination rectangle (where on the window the camera will display). Measured in pixels. Destination uses an inverted Y (positive points down).

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Camera.BottomDestination
member.summary: Gets and sets the bottom side of the destination rectangle (where on the window the camera will display). Measured in pixels. Destination uses an inverted Y (positive points down).

member.summary: Gets and sets the left side of the destination rectangle (where on the window the camera will display). Measured in pixels.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Camera.RightDestination
member.summary: Gets and sets the right side of the destination rectangle (where on the window the camera will display). Measured in pixels.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Camera.DestinationRectangle
member.summary: Represents the top left justified area the Camera will draw over.
member.remarks:
This represents the area in pixel coordinates that the camera will display relative to the top left of the owning Control. If the Control is resized, the camera should modify its DestinationRectangle to match the new area.
Multiple cameras with different DestinationRectangles can be used to display split screen or picture-in-picture.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Camera.ClearsDepthBuffer
member.summary: Whether this camera clears the depth buffer when rendering. If true (the default) this camera clears the depth buffer, z-buffered sprites write to the depth buffer, and ordered objects render considering the depth buffer.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Camera.AspectRatio
member.summary: The width/height of the view of the camera
member.remarks: This determines the ratio of the width to height of the camera. By default, the aspect ratio is 4/3, but this should be changed for widescreen monitors or in situations using multiple cameras. For example, if a game is in split screen with a vertical split, then each camera will show the same height, but half the width. The aspect ratio should be 2/3.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Camera.Orthogonal
member.summary: Returns whether the camera is using an orthogonal perspective. If true, the camera is a "2D" camera.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Camera.DrawsCameraLayer
member.summary: Whether the camera draws its layers.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Camera.DrawsWorld
member.summary: Whether the Camera draws world objects (objects not on the Camera's Layer). This is true by default. This is usually set to false for cameras used in render targets which only draw layers.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Camera.DrawsShapes
member.summary: Whether the Camera draws shapes

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Camera.DrawsToScreen

member.param: The layer to remove

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Camera.SetBordersAtZ(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Sets the visible borders when the camera is looking down the Z axis.
member.remarks: This sets visibility ranges for the camera. That is, if the camera's maximumX is set to 100 at a zToSetAt of 0, the camera will never be able to see the point x = 101, z = 0. The camera imposes these limitations by calculating the actual minimum and maximum values according to the variables passed. Also, the camera keeps track of these visible limits and readjusts the mimimum and maximum values when the camera moves in the z direction. Therefore, it is only necessary to set these values once, and the camera will remeber that these are the visibility borders, regardless of its position. It is important to note that the visiblity borders can be violated if they are too close together - if a camera moves so far back that its viewable area at the set Z is greater than the set minimumX and maximumX range, the camera will show an area outside of this range.
member.param: The minimum x value of the visiblity border.
The minimum y value of the visiblity border.
The maximum x value of the visiblity border.
The maximum y value of the visiblity border.
The z value of the plane to use for the visibility border.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Camera.SetCameraTo(FlatRedBall.Camera)
member.summary: Copies all fields from the argument to the camera instance.
member.remarks: This method will not copy the name, InstructionArray, or children PositionedObjects (objects attached to the cameraToSetTo).
member.param: The camera to clone.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Camera.UsePixelCoordinates
member.summary: Sets the camera to be 2D (far-away things do not get smaller) by setting Orthogonal to true and adjusts the OrthogonalWidth and OrthogonalHeight to match the pixel resolution. In other words, this makes 1 unit in game match 1 pixel on screen.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Camera.CalculateMaxAndMins
member.summary: Calculates the minimum and maximum X values for the camera based off of its base values (such as mBaseMaximumX) and its current view

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Camera.UpdateDestinationRectangle
member.summary: Updates the destination rectangle (for the viewport). Also fixes the aspect ratio.

member.summary: Sets the aspectRatio to match the width/height of the area that the camera is drawing to.
member.remarks: This is usually used in applications with split screen or when on a widescreen display.

member.summary: Checks if an Entity is within the Camera's boundaries.

A buffer zone to account for entity size on boundary check. Defaults to 0
member.returns: Returns true in case it is inside the camera's boundaries, false otherwise

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Camera.IsEntityInView(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector3,System.Single)
member.summary: Checks if an object with Vector3 position is inside the Camera's boundaries.
member.param: The position of the entity to check
A buffer zone to account for entity size on boundary check. Defaults to 0
member.returns: Returns true in case it is inside the camera's boundaries, false otherwise

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Camera.IsSpriteInView(FlatRedBall.Sprite,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns whether the argument sprite is in view, considering the CameraCullMode. This will always return true if cull mode is set to None.
member.remarks: This method does not do a perfectly precise check of whether the Sprite is on screen or not, as such a check would require considering the Sprite's rotation. Instead, this uses approximations to avoid trigonometric functions, and will err on the side of returning true when a Sprite may actually be out of view.
member.param: The sprite to check in view
Whether the sprite's position is relative to the camera. This value may be true if the sprite is on a Layer, and the Layer's RelativeToCamera value is true.
member.returns: Whether the sprite is in view

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Camera.IsXInView(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Determines if the X value is in view, assuming the camera is viewing down the Z axis.
member.remarks: Currently, this method assumes viewing down the Z axis.
member.param: The absolute X position of the point.
The absolute Z position of the point.

member.summary: Determines if the Y value is in view, assuming the camera is viewing down the Z axis.
member.remarks: Currently, this method assumes viewing down the Z axis.
member.param: The absolute Y position of the point.
The absolute Z position of the point.

member.remarks: If using the PixelsPerUnitAt for a rotated camera, use the overload which takes a Vector3 argument.

member.returns: The number of pixels per world unit (perpendicular to the camera's forward vector).

member.summary: Sets the camera to Orthogonal, sets the OrthogonalWidth and OrthogonalHeight to match the argument values, and can move the so the bottom-left corner of the screen is at the origin.

member.summary: The SpriteSaveBase that stores most of the Properties for the SpriteSave.
member.remarks: The SpriteSaveBase is used as a storage of properties because nearly all of its properties are also used by SpriteFrames. Therefore, to prevent a lot of copy/paste, this class is used to store properties.

member.name: T:FlatRedBall.Graphics.Particle.Emitter
member.summary: An emitter is an invisible object which can create one or more Sprites at a specific rate or on a method call.

member.name: F:FlatRedBall.Graphics.Particle.Emitter.RemovalEventType.None
member.summary: No removal event specified.

member.name: F:FlatRedBall.Graphics.Particle.Emitter.RemovalEventType.OutOfScreen
member.summary: Particles will be removed when out of the screen.
member.remarks: This uses the camera's IsSpriteInView method.

member.name: F:FlatRedBall.Graphics.Particle.Emitter.RemovalEventType.Alpha0
member.summary: Particles will be removed when Alpha is 0
member.remarks: Setting the Alpha to 0 manually on a particle created by an emitter with this removal event will also remove the Sprite.

member.name: F:FlatRedBall.Graphics.Particle.Emitter.RemovalEventType.Timed
member.summary: Particles will be removed after a certain amount of time has passed after emission. This value is set through the SecondsLasting property.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Graphics.Particle.Emitter.BoundedEmission
member.summary: If true, restricts this emitter to only emit when its EmissionBoundary is within the camera's view. This defaults to false, which means the emitter will ignore camera bounds when attempting to emit.
member.remarks: BoundedEmission can be used to improve the performance of your game, by reducing the number of off-screen particles which the engine has to manage.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Graphics.Particle.Emitter.AreaEmission
member.summary: Sets the area which defines where new particles can appear. By default this is set to Point, which means emitted particles will appear at the Emitter's Position.
member.remarks: If the AreaEmission is set to Rectangle or Cube, then the ScaleX, ScaleY, and ScaleZ values are used.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Graphics.Particle.Emitter.TimedEmission
member.summary: Controls whether emission occurs on a timer when calling TimedEmit.
member.remarks: This variable is only useful when calling TimedEmit. It enables code to call TimedEmit in one area and to control the emission variable in another.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Graphics.Particle.Emitter.SecondsLasting
member.summary: Specifies the number of seconds that particles will remain on the screen and in memory. This is only considered if the RemovalEvent is set to RemovalEventType.TIMED;

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Graphics.Particle.Emitter.RemovalEvent
member.summary: Specifies the type of logic to perform for removing the particle.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Graphics.Particle.Emitter.Emit(FlatRedBall.SpriteList)
member.summary: Emits particles as specified by the Emitter class
member.remarks:
This method initiates one emission of particles. The number of particles emitted depends on the numberPerEmission variable. This method does not consider emission timing, and the time is not recorded for emission timing.
The argument SpriteList stores all Sprites which were emitted during the call. The Sprites are added regularly, rather than in a one way relationship. This enables modification of emitted particles after the method ends. null can be passed as an argument if specific action is not needed for emitted particles. Particles are automatically created through the SpriteManager as Particle Sprites.
member.param: The list of Sprites (which can be null) to add all Sprites created by this call.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Graphics.Particle.Emitter.TimedEmit(FlatRedBall.SpriteList)
member.summary: Checks if the emitter is ready to emit, and if so, performs an emit. This method will only emit if TimedEmission is set to true. Emitters which have TimedEmission set to true will typically have TimedEmit called every frame.

member.name: T:FlatRedBall.Graphics.Particle.EmitterList
member.summary: List of Emitters provoding shortcut methods for interacting with all contained Emittes.
member.remarks: This is the runtime object created when loading .emix files.

member.summary: The rate of change of the red component in units per second.

member.summary: The rate of change of the green component in units per second.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Graphics.IColorable.BlueRate
member.summary: The rate of change of the blue component in units per second.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Graphics.IColorable.ColorOperation
member.summary: The color operation to perform using the color component values and Texture (if available).

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Graphics.IColorable.BlendOperation
member.summary: The blend operation to perform using the alpha component value and Texture (if available).

member.name: T:FlatRedBall.Graphics.IDestroyable
member.summary: Provides a Destroy method, generally used by Glue generated classes

member.name: T:FlatRedBall.Graphics.IVisible
member.summary: Interface for an object which has visibility control.

member.name: F:FlatRedBall.Graphics.LayerCameraSettings.OrthogonalWidth
member.summary: The orthogonal width to use when drawing this layer, if Orthogonal is true.

member.name: F:FlatRedBall.Graphics.LayerCameraSettings.OrthogonalHeight
member.summary: The orthogonal height to use when drawing this layer, if Orthogonal is true;

member.name: F:FlatRedBall.Graphics.LayerCameraSettings.TopDestination
member.summary: Sets the top destination for this Layer.
member.remarks: By default, this value is set to -1, which means that the Layer will use its parent Camera's destination. All four destination values must be greater than or equal to 0 to be applied. If any are less than -1, then the Camera's destination values are used.

member.name: F:FlatRedBall.Graphics.LayerCameraSettings.BottomDestination
member.summary: Sets the bottom destination for this Layer. Destination Y values increase when moving down the screen, so this value should be greater than TopDestination (if it is not -1).
member.remarks: By default, this value is set to -1, which means that the Layer will use its parent Camera's destination. All four destination values must be greater than or equal to 0 to be applied. If any are less than -1, then the Camera's destination values are used.

member.name: F:FlatRedBall.Graphics.LayerCameraSettings.LeftDestination
member.summary: Sets the left destination for this Layer.
member.remarks: By default, this value is set to -1, which means that the Layer will use its parent Camera's destination. All four destination values must be greater than or equal to 0 to be applied. If any are less than -1, then the Camera's destination values are used.

member.name: F:FlatRedBall.Graphics.LayerCameraSettings.RightDestination
member.summary: Sets the right destination for this Layer.
member.remarks: By default, this value is set to -1, which means that the Layer will use its parent Camera's destination. All four destination values must be greater than or equal to 0 to be applied. If any are less than -1, then the Camera's destination values are used.

member.name: T:FlatRedBall.Graphics.Layer
member.summary: Layers are objects which can contain other graphical objects for drawing. Layers are used to create specific ordering and can be used to override depth buffer and z-sorted ordering.

member.name: F:FlatRedBall.Graphics.Layer.mSprites
member.summary: List of Sprites that belong to this layer. Sprites should be added through SpriteManager.AddToLayer or the AddSprite overloads which include a Layer argument.

member.name: F:FlatRedBall.Graphics.Layer.mOverridingFieldOfView
member.summary: Used by the Renderer to override the camera's FieldOfView when drawing the layer. This can be used to give each layer a different field of view.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Graphics.Layer.Batches
member.summary: The Batches referenced by and drawn on the Layer.
member.remarks:
The Layer stores a regular IDrawableBatch PositionedObjectList internally. Since this internal list is used for drawing the layer the engine sorts it every frame.
For efficiency purposes the internal IDrawableBatch PositionedObjectList cannot be sorted.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Graphics.Layer.LayerCameraSettings
member.summary: Stores values which are used to override the camera's properties when this Layer is rendered. By default this is null, indicating the Layer should match the Camera view.
member.remarks: A new instance of LayerCameraSettings will be assigned if the UsePixelCoordiantes is called.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Graphics.Layer.RelativeToCamera
member.summary: Controls whether all objects on this layer are drawn relative to the camera. If this value is true, then objects with a position of 0,0 will be positioned at the center of the camera. This value is false by default, which means objects on this layer will be positioned relative to world coordinates.
member.remarks: Setting this value to true is an alternative to attaching all objects to the camera. Using this value has a number of benefits: - It removes the overhead of attachment if dealing with a large number of objects - It removes "jittering" which can occur when attaching to a rotating camera

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Graphics.Layer.Sprites
member.summary: The Sprites referenced by and drawn on the Layer.
member.remarks: The Layer stores a regular SpriteList internally. Since this internal list is used for drawing the layer the engine sorts it every frame.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Graphics.Layer.Texts
member.summary: The Texts referenced by and drawn on the Layer.
member.remarks:
The Layer stores a regular Text PositionedObjectList internally. Since this internal list is used for drawing the layer the engine sorts it every frame.
For efficiency purposes the internal Text PositionedObjectList cannot be sorted.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Graphics.Layer.SortType
member.summary: The SortType used for visible objects placed on this layer. Only objects on this layer will use this sort type. Each layer can have its own sort type, and unlayered visible objects will use the SpriteManager.OrderedSortType SortType.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Graphics.Layer.Visible
member.summary: Whether the SpriteLayer is visible.
member.remarks: This does not set the contained Sprite's visible value to false.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Graphics.Layer.RenderTarget
member.summary: The render target to render to. If this is null (default), then the layer will render to whatever render target has been set before FlatRedBall's drawing code starts. If this is non-null, then the layer will render to the RenderTarget. If multiple layers use the same RenderTarget, they will all render to it without clearing it.
member.remarks: If a Layer uses a RenderTarget, it will clear the render target if: - It is the UnderAll layer - It is the first Layer on a camera - It uses a different RenderTarget than the previous Layer.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Graphics.Layer.AddManualSpriteOneWay(FlatRedBall.Sprite)
member.summary: Directly adds a sprite to the sprite list for this layer. This is faster than using the SpriteManager.AddToLayer method but does no automatic updating and performs a one way add.
member.param: The sprite to be added.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Graphics.Layer.Remove(FlatRedBall.Sprite)
member.summary: Removes the argument Sprite from being drawn on this Layer. Note that this does not remove the sprite from the SpriteManager. This method can be used to move a Sprite from one layer to another.
member.param: The Sprite to remove from this layer.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Graphics.Layer.UsePixelCoordinates
member.summary: Instantiates a new LayerCameraSettings object to store pixel-perfect values.

member.name: T:FlatRedBall.Graphics.RenderMode
member.summary: Rendering modes available in FlatRedBall

member.name: F:FlatRedBall.Graphics.RenderMode.Default
member.summary: Default rendering mode (uses embedded effects in models)

member.name: F:FlatRedBall.Graphics.RenderMode.Color
member.summary: Color rendering mode - renders color values for a model (does not include lighting information) Effect technique: RenderColor

member.name: F:FlatRedBall.Graphics.RenderMode.Normals
member.summary: Normals rendering mode - renders normals Effect technique: RenderNormals

member.name: F:FlatRedBall.Graphics.RenderMode.Depth
member.summary: Depth rendering mode - renders depth Effect technique: RenderDepth

member.name: F:FlatRedBall.Graphics.RenderMode.Position
member.summary: Position rendering mode - renders position Effect technique: RenderPosition

member.name: T:FlatRedBall.Graphics.Renderer
member.summary: Static class responsible for drawing/rendering content to the cameras on screen.
member.remarks: This class is called by

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Graphics.Renderer.Camera
member.summary: Gets the default Camera (SpriteManager.Camera)

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Graphics.Renderer.Cameras
member.summary: Gets the list of cameras (SpriteManager.Cameras)

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Graphics.Renderer.UpdateSorting
member.summary: Controls whether the renderer will refresh the sorting of its internal lists in the next draw call.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Graphics.Renderer.UpdateDrawableBatches
member.summary: Controls whether the renderer will update the drawable batches in the next draw call.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Graphics.Renderer.CurrentLayer
member.summary: Returns the Layer currently being rendered. Can be used in IDrawableBatches and debug code.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Graphics.Renderer.RecordRenderBreaks
member.summary: Tells the renderer to record and keep track of render breaks so they can be used when optimizing rendering. This value defaults to false

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Graphics.Renderer.LastFrameRenderBreakList
member.summary: Contains the list of Render Breaks from the previous frame. This is updated every time FlatRedBall is drawn.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Graphics.Renderer.LinearizeTextures
member.summary: When this is enabled texture colors will be translated to linear space before any other shader operations are performed. This is useful for games with lighting and other special shader effects. If the colors are left in gamma space the shader calculations will crush the colors and not look like natural lighting. Delinearization must be done by the developer in the last render step when rendering to the screen. This technique is called gamma correction. Disabled by default.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Graphics.Renderer.ColorOperation
member.summary: Sets the color operation on the graphics device if the set value differs from the current value. This is public so that IDrawableBatches can set the color ops.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Graphics.Renderer.BlendOperation
member.summary: Sets the blend operation on the graphics device if the set value differs from the current value. If the two values are the same, then the property doesn't do anything.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Graphics.Renderer.DrawQuad(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector3,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector3)
member.summary: Draws a quad The effect must already be started

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Graphics.Renderer.DrawFullScreenQuad
member.summary: Draws a full-screen quad The effect must already be started

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Graphics.Text.DisplayText
member.summary: Gets or sets the string that the Text object is to display.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Graphics.Text.AdjustedText
member.summary: Returns the strin that the Text object will render. This considers the MaxWidth and MaxWidthBehavior variables, meaning it may contain newlines.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Graphics.Text.HorizontalCenter
member.summary: Returns the center of the text object.
member.remarks: If the text is centered (the format.alignment equals TextManager.Alignment.CENTER), this will simply return the x value of the text. Otherwise, this property calculates the center of the text based on the contained string, the format, whether the text uses 3D fonts, and the x position of the text.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Graphics.Text.AlphaRate
member.summary: The rate of change of the alpha component in units per second.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Graphics.Text.NumberOfLines
member.summary: Returns the number of lines in the text object.
member.remarks: This currently reports the number of lines only when the text object is using a bitmap font. 3D text does not use the newline character.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Graphics.Text.MaxWidth
member.summary: The maximum width of the text in world units. This modifies the DisplayedText property.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Graphics.Text.ScaleX
member.summary: Returns the distance from the center of the Text object to the edge;

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Graphics.Text.VerticalCenter
member.summary: Returns the vertical center of the text.
member.remarks: Since the y value of text marks either the top or bottom of the Text depending on vertical alignment, this value can be useful for finding the Text's center.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Graphics.Text.Clone
member.summary: Creates a new Text object.
member.returns: Reference to the new Text object. The object will not be in the TextManager's memory.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Graphics.Text.SetColor(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Set the RGB properties of this all at once. 0,0,0 is Black, 1,1,1 is White.
member.param: 0 to 1
0 to 1
0 to 1

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Graphics.Text.SetPixelPerfectScale(FlatRedBall.Camera,System.Single)
member.summary: Sets the Scale and Spacing such that the Text is drawn pixel-perfect at its given Z position.
member.param: Reference to the camera to use when calculating the Scale and Spacing.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Graphics.Text.SetPixelPerfectScale(FlatRedBall.Graphics.Layer)
member.summary: Sets the Scale and Spacing such that the Text is drawn pixel-perfect at the given Z position. This method obeys the Layer's overridden field of view if it uses one.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Graphics.Text.UpdateDisplayedText
member.summary: Updates the displayed text according to the MaxWidth.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Graphics.Text.ContentManager
member.summary: The ContentManager used to store textures generated by the Text. This is required for proper cleanup.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Graphics.TextManager.AddText(System.String,FlatRedBall.Camera)
member.summary: Creates a new Text with the argument string which will only be drawn in the argument Camera's destination.
member.remarks: The new text will be stored both by the camera and the TextManager's managed invisible Texts array. The text is automatically attached to the argument Camera so to be moved, it must either be detached or moved with relative variables.
member.param: The string to show.
The camera that the newly created Text belongs to.
member.returns: Reference to the newly created Text.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Graphics.TextManager.AddText(FlatRedBall.Graphics.Text,FlatRedBall.Camera)
member.summary: Adds an already-created Text instance to the argument camera.
member.remarks: The argument Text should not already be in the TextManager's memory when this method is called.
member.param: Reference to the text object to add.
Reference to the camera to be added to.
member.returns: The added text.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Graphics.TextManager.AddManuallyUpdated(FlatRedBall.Graphics.Text,FlatRedBall.Graphics.Layer)
member.summary: Adds a text object to the TextManager to be drawn, but which will not have its every-frame activity called.
member.param: The text to add.
The optional layer to add to. If null, the Text will be unlayered.
member.remarks: Texts added with AddManuallyUpdated will not be visible unless they have their UpdateDependencies or ForceUpdateDependencies called after all properties have been assigned.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Graphics.TextManager.GetWidth(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the width of the rendered text assuming the spacing is 1.
member.remarks: If there are newline characters in the string, GetWidth returns the width of the longest line. Spaces are considered characters as well so "Hello " will be longer than "Hello".
member.param: The text to measure.
member.returns: The width of the longest line in the text.

member.name: T:FlatRedBall.Graphics.Texture.RenderTargetSprite
member.summary: A Sprite-inheriting object which can reference one or more Layers to use as "input". The input will be rendered and stored on a Texture2D for the Sprite. This provides the ability to improve rendering speed of complex objects by rendering to a Texutre2D one time. It also provides additional support for transformations, such as rotating a collection of objects.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Graphics.Texture.RenderTargetSprite.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Instantiates a new RenderTargetSprite with a render target matching the spriteName belonging to the argument ContentManagerName
member.param: The content manager name which the RenderTarget should belong to. This is used to dispose the RenderTarget, and will usually match the current screen's content manager name.
The name of the Sprite, which is shared with the render target. This is required

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Graphics.Texture.RenderTargetSprite.Refresh
member.summary: Renders all objects contained in this instance's DefaultInputLayer and additionally added input layers to the internally referenced Sprite. This can be called every frame, or it can be called only when the internal objects change. Refresh should be called at least one time, or the render target may contain unexpected content.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Graphics.Texture.RenderTargetSprite.AddInputLayer(FlatRedBall.Graphics.Layer)
member.summary: Adds a Layer to be rendered by the RenderTargetSprite above all previously added Layers and above the DefaultInputLayer. If the argument layer is part of the SpriteManager, it will be removed.
member.param: The Layer to use as an input layer on this RenderTargetSprite.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Graphics.Texture.ImageData.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Constructs a new ImageData object of the given width and height with the argument data stored as a byte array.
member.param: Width of the image data
Height of the image data
Data as a byte array

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Graphics.Texture.ImageData.RemoveRow(System.Int32)
member.summary: Removes the index row from the contained data. Row 0 is the top of the texture.
member.param: The index of the row to remove. Index 0 is the top row.

member.name: F:FlatRedBall.Entities.TargetApproachStyle.Immediate
member.summary: The camera moves to the target position immediately, effectively locking on to its position.

member.name: F:FlatRedBall.Entities.TargetApproachStyle.Smooth
member.summary: The camera moves to the target position smoothly, but not at a constant speed. The camera will move faster if it is further away from the target, and slower if it is closer.

member.name: F:FlatRedBall.Entities.TargetApproachStyle.ConstantSpeed
member.summary: The camera moves to the target at a constant speed, regardless of the distance between the camera and the target.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Entities.CameraControllingEntity.Camera
member.summary: The camera controlled by this instance.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Entities.CameraControllingEntity.BehaviorType
member.summary: Defines the behavior of the camera when determining its target position. Currently it always performs PositionLocking, but additional types of bhehavior may be added in the future.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Entities.CameraControllingEntity.Targets
member.summary: The target PositionedObjects to follow. In a single-player game this can be one entity. In a multi-player game, this can be all players. The camera will average their position and follow the average.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Entities.CameraControllingEntity.Target
member.summary: Sets a single target for following. If Targets has been previously set, this changes the Targets to a new list.
member.remarks: If the target is an Entity, then the entity is destroyed, it will be removed as the CameraControllingEntity target.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Entities.CameraControllingEntity.Map
member.summary: The level map. If null, the camera will move without bounds. If set, the camera will not view positions outside of the map.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Entities.CameraControllingEntity.ExtraMapPadding
member.summary: Extra padding which can be used to add a buffer between the edge of the actual map and the desired visible edge. A positive value adds padding, effective shrinking the available area that the camera can view. A negative value allows the camera to move outside of the map.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Entities.CameraControllingEntity.TargetApproachStyle
member.summary: The type of approach to use when moving the camera to the target position.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Entities.CameraControllingEntity.LerpSmoothZoom
member.summary: Whether to smoothly approach the desired zoom. If false, the camera immediately adjusts zoom without any smoothing.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Entities.CameraControllingEntity.ViewableAreaMultiplier
member.summary: The value used to mulitply the OrthogonalWidth and OrthogonalHeight. A larger value means the camera is more zoomed out, and can see more of the game world. A smaller value means the camera is zoomed in, so it can see less of the game world.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Entities.CameraControllingEntity.MaxViewableAreaMultiplier
member.summary: Returns the maximum possible value that ViewableAreaMultiplier can be set to. This is based on the size of the presence and size of the map. If Map is null, this returns float.PositiveInfinity.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Entities.CameraControllingEntity.MaxViewableAreaWidth
member.summary: Returns the maximum possible viewable width when the camera is zoomed out as far as possible. This is based on the size of the presence and size of the map.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Entities.CameraControllingEntity.MaxViewableAreaHeight
member.summary: Returns the maximum possible viewable height when the camera is zoomed out as far as possible. This is based on the size of the presence and size of the map.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Entities.CameraControllingEntity.TargetApproachCoefficient
member.summary: The amount of smoothing. The larger the number, faster the Camera moves. This value is ignored if TargetApproachStyle is Immediate.
member.remarks: If TargetApproachStyle is Smooth, this is the velocity value per pixel offset from the target. For example, if this value is 5, and the target is 20 pixels away, then the velocity of the camera will be 20*5 = 100. If TargetApproachStyle is ConstantSpeed, this is the speed of the camera in pixels per second regardless of the distance to the target.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Entities.CameraControllingEntity.SnapToPixel
member.summary: Whether to snap the camera position to the screen pixel. This value can be used to prevent half-pixels from being drawn.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Entities.CameraControllingEntity.SnapToPixelOffset
member.summary: The offset to apply when snapping to pixel. This can be used to improve rendering depending on the pixel that is sampled by graphics cards.
member.remarks: This value has only been tested on a limited number of devices/games. It's not clear if this should be a fixed value, or if it should depend

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Entities.CameraControllingEntity.IsActive
member.summary: Whether to perform logic in the Activity call. This exists to allow control over whether Activity should apply if Activity is called in generated code. This can be set to false to manually override the camera following behavior.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Entities.CameraControllingEntity.ScrollingWindowWidth
member.summary: The width of the scrolling window. If an object is inside of the scrolling window, the CameraControllingEntity will not move the camera.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Entities.CameraControllingEntity.ScrollingWindowHeight
member.summary: The height of the scrolling window. If an object is inside of the scrolling window, the CameraControllingEntity will not move the camera.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Entities.CameraControllingEntity.Visible
member.summary: Whether the visualization of the window is visible. This is typically only used to diagnose problems.

member.name: F:FlatRedBall.Entities.CameraControllingEntity.CameraOffset
member.summary: The offset to use when positioning the camera relative to this instance's position. By default this is 0, but setting a non-zero results in the camera always being positioned by an offset.
member.example: Setting this value to have a positive Y results in the Camera's center being above this instance's Y.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Entities.CameraControllingEntity.#ctor
member.summary: Instantiates a new CameraControllingEntity which follows the main Camear (Camera.Main).

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Entities.CameraControllingEntity.EnableAutoZooming(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Enables auto zooming which will zoom the camera (adjust orthogonal values) to attempt to keep all targets in screen.
member.param: The default camera orthogonal width. Usually this will be CameraSetup.Data.ResolutionWidth.
The default camera orthogonal height. Usually this will be CameraSetup.Data.ResolutionHeight.
The furthest the camera can zoom. A value of 1 prevents any zoom. A value of 2 allows 2 times as much to be seen. A value of float.PositiveInfinity allows the camera to zoom indefinitely.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Entities.CameraControllingEntity.Activity
member.summary: Performs every frame activity which updates this instance's position according to its targets and interpolation/zoom values. This is typically called in generated code if the CameraControllingEntity is part of a Screen in the FRB Editor.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Entities.CameraControllingEntity.GetTarget
member.summary: Returns the desired position of the camera (X and Y) given the position of all Targets and the bounds of the camera.
member.returns: The target X and Y of the camera.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Entities.CameraControllingEntity.ForceToTarget
member.summary: Immediately gets the destination position according to the current targets and sets this instance's position to that destination. This can be called to snap to the target position without any smoothing.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Entities.CameraControllingEntity.ShakeScreen(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Shakes the screen for a certain duration. This can be used to create a screen shake effect.
member.param: The shake radius - a larger value creates more shaking.
How long to perofrm shaking in seconds.
member.returns: A task which is completed when the shaking finishes.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Entities.CameraControllingEntity.ShakeScreenUntil(System.Single,System.Threading.Tasks.Task)
member.summary: Shakes the camera until the taskToAwait is completed. This can be used to shake the camera until a certain event occurs.
member.param: The shake radius - a larger value creates more shaking.
The task to await before shaking stops.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Entities.IDamageable.ModifyDamageReceived
member.summary: Event raised before damage is dealt. This event can be used to modify the damage dealt.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Entities.IDamageable.ReactToDamageReceived
member.summary: Event raised when damage is received. This is called after CurrentHealth has been modified.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Entities.DamageableExtensionMethods.ShouldTakeDamage(FlatRedBall.Entities.IDamageable,FlatRedBall.Entities.IDamageArea)
member.summary: Returns whether the argument IDamageable should take damage from the argument IDamageArea. This returns true if the team indexes are different, if the damageable has > 0 CurrentHealth, and if enough time has passed since the last damage was dealt by this particular IDamageArea instance.

The minimum value to clamp to

member.name: T:FlatRedBall.Math.Geometry.AxisAlignedRectangle
member.summary: A rectangle which can be used to perform collison checks against other shapes. The name "axis aligned" implies that the rectangle cannot be rotated. Its sides will always be aligned (parallel) with the X and Y axes. The AxisAlignedRectangle is a shape commonly used in FlatRedBall Entities to perform collision against other entities and TileShapeCollections.

member.name: F:FlatRedBall.Math.Geometry.AxisAlignedRectangle.RepositionHalfSize
member.summary: Whether collision reposition should consider the full size of the AxisAlignedRectangle. If false, repositions along one of the directions will only start at the halfway point and move outward.
member.remarks: This property is primarily used for "L-shaped" collision areas on tile maps. Tiles which make up the corner of the L should have this value set to true. Otherwise, collisions may result in an object tunneling through the collision.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Math.Geometry.AxisAlignedRectangle.Left
member.summary: The absolute left edge of the AxisAlignedRectangle, calculated by subtracting half of its width from its position; Setting this value will change its Position.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Math.Geometry.AxisAlignedRectangle.LastCollisionSegment
member.summary: Returns the colliding from the last collision checked. The possible collision segments are the top, bottom, left and right rectangle edges.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Math.Geometry.AxisAlignedRectangle.CollideAgainst(FlatRedBall.Math.Geometry.Circle)
member.summary: Returns whether this instance collides against the argument Circle.
member.param: The Circle to test collision against.
member.returns: Whether collision has occurred.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Math.Geometry.AxisAlignedRectangle.CollideAgainst(FlatRedBall.Math.Geometry.AxisAlignedRectangle)
member.summary: Returns whether this instance collides against the argument AxisAlignedRectangle.
member.param: The AxisAlignedRectangle to test collision against.

member.summary: Returns whether this AxisAlignedRectangle and the argument AxisAlignedRectangle overkap, and reposition sthe two according ot their relative masses.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Math.Geometry.AxisAlignedRectangle.CollideAgainstMove(FlatRedBall.Math.Geometry.Polygon,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Performs a "move" collision (a collision that adjusts the Position of the calling objects to separate them if they overlap), moving each object according to its respective mass.
member.param: The polygon to collide against.
The mass of the AxisAlignedRectangle. If value this is 0, the AxisAlignedRectangle will act as if it has no mass - the Polygon will not be pushed or stopped.
The mass of the Polygon. If this value is 0, The Polygon will act as if it has no mass - the AxisAlignedRectangle will not be pushed or stopped.
member.returns: Whether the caller collides against the argument Polygon.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Math.Geometry.AxisAlignedRectangle.CollideAgainstMoveSoft(FlatRedBall.Math.Geometry.AxisAlignedRectangle,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Returns whether this AxisAlignedRectangle and the argument AxisAlignedRectangle overlap, and repositions the two according to their relative masses and the depth of the overlap. The more overlap, the faster the two objects will separate.
member.param: The other rectangle to collide against.
This mass relative to the other rectangle.
The other rectangle's mass relative to this.

The separation velocity in units per second. This value is multiplied by the overlap amount to result in a velocity. For example, if separationVelocity is 2 and the objects overlap by 100 units, then the total separation velocity will be 2*100 = 200. This total separation velocity will be applied proportionally to this and the other rectangle according to their relative masses. Increasing this value will make the separation happen more quickly.
member.returns: Whether collision has occurred.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Math.Geometry.AxisAlignedRectangle.CollideAgainstMovePositionSoft(FlatRedBall.Math.Geometry.AxisAlignedRectangle,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Returns whether this AxisAlignedRectangle and the argument AxisAlignedRectangle overlap, and repositions the two according to their relative masses and the depth of the overlap. The more overlap, the faster the two objects will separate.
member.param: The other rectangle to collide against.
This mass relative to the other rectangle.
The other rectangle's mass relative to this.

The separation velocity in units per second. This value is multiplied by the overlap amount to result in a velocity. For example, if separationVelocity is 2 and the objects overlap by 100 units, then the total separation velocity will be 2*100 = 200. This total separation velocity will be applied proportionally to this and the other rectangle according to their relative masses. Increasing this value will make the separation happen more quickly.
member.returns: Whether collision has occurred.

member.name: F:FlatRedBall.Math.Geometry.Polygon.TolerateEmptyPolygons
member.summary: Whether the Polygon object can have its Points assigned to null. Normally this is false, which means assigning Points to null will result in an exception. This is set to true in edit mode to enable the user to change polygon points without the game crashing.

member.name: F:FlatRedBall.Math.Geometry.Polygon.mPoints
member.summary: The points relative to the center of the Polygon. These define the shape and size of the Polygon.

member.name: F:FlatRedBall.Math.Geometry.Polygon.mCenterPoints
member.summary: The midpoint Points used for collision. These are updated in CollideAgainstMovePreview.

member.name: F:FlatRedBall.Math.Geometry.Polygon.mVertices
member.summary: The vertices that get fed into the VertexBuffer when the polygon is rendered. The position is calculated by positioning the mPoints relative to the polygon using its position and rotation properties. This is done in the FillVertexArray method (similar to the Text object)
member.remarks: These vertices contain the absolute vertices of the polygon, so they can be used in collision requiring these positions (rather than calculating them using mPoints and position/rotation values.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Math.Geometry.Polygon.RepositionDirections
member.summary: Sets the directions that the polygon can perform collision - this is only considered if the polygon is convex and clockwise.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Math.Geometry.Polygon.BoundingRectangle
member.summary: Axis aligned rectangle which bounds the polygon. Contains absolute positions.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Math.Geometry.Polygon.Points
member.summary: The Position-relative points of the Polygon. A point at 0,0 will be positioned at the center of the Polygon.
member.remarks: This value can be assigned to completely replace the points in a polygon. Changing this list updates the Vertices internally and immediately makes the polygon available for rendering. Note that a closed polygon will have its first point repeated. For example a closed rectangle will have 5 points (the normal 4 points, plus the last point repeating the first).

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Math.Geometry.Polygon.LastMoveCollisionReposition
member.summary: Reports the vector along which this polygon was moved along during the last CollideAgainstMove method.
member.remarks:
This value is reset every time CollideAgainstMove is called whether there is a successful collision or not. If there is no collision, this value is set to Vector3.Zero. If reactions to collisions such as physics are being implemented using this value, then the behavior should be tested and applied after every call to CollideAgainstMove.
This value is set on both the instance calling the CollideAgainstMove method as well as the argument.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Math.Geometry.Polygon.LastCollisionPoint
member.summary: The absolute position where the last collision was detected in a CollideAgainst method.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Math.Geometry.Polygon.LastCollisionSegment
member.summary: Returns the colliding from the last collision checked.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Math.Geometry.Polygon.AbsolutePointPosition(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the absolute (world) position of the point at the argument pointIndex. This considers the Polygon's position and rotation.
member.remarks: This method internally uses the vertices of the polygon to return the position. These vertices are updated every frame if the polygon is part of the ShapeManager. If a Polygon is not part of the ShapeManager, or if a change (such as position) has been performed on the polygon and the AbsolutePointPosition is needed immediately, then ForceUpdateDependencies can be called to update the verts internally.
member.param: The 0-based index of the points.
member.returns: The absolute world position of the vert at the argument pointIndex.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Math.AttachableList`1.MakeOneWay
member.summary: Breaks all two-way relationships between this and all contained IAttachables.
member.remarks: This will still contain the same number of IAttachables before and after the call.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Math.AttachableList`1.MakeTwoWay
member.summary: Makes the relationship between all contained IAttachables and this a two way relationship.
member.remarks: If an IAttachable is added (through the Add method), the relationship is already a two-way relationship. IAttachables which already have two-way relationships will not be affected by this call. IAttachables that have been added through the AddOneWay call or added through a call that returns a one-way array will be modified so that they hold a reference to this instance in their ListsBelongingTo field. One-way relationships are often created in FRB methods which return AttachableLists.

member.summary: A class storing enumerations for collisions.

member.name: T:FlatRedBall.Math.Collision.CollisionManager
member.summary: Stores and executes collision relationships.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Math.Collision.CollisionManager.Relationships
member.summary: The relationships which are currently part of the collision manager. This should not be added to by regular game code. This is exposed so that collision manager extension methods can add new relationships, and so relationships can be cleared.

member.name: F:FlatRedBall.Math.Collision.LoopDirection.BackToFront
member.summary: Indicates that loops will run from back to front (a reverse loop)

member.name: F:FlatRedBall.Math.Collision.LoopDirection.FrontToBack
member.summary: Indicates that loops will run from front to back (normal loop)

member.name: T:FlatRedBall.Math.Collision.CollisionRelationship
member.summary: Base implementation for object which provides collision logic between two objects.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Math.Collision.CollisionRelationship.CollidedThisFrame
member.summary: Whether a collision occurred this frame. This is set when the collision performs its collision logic in DoCollisions, which may get called automatically, or may get called manually if IsActive is set to false.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Math.Collision.CollisionRelationship.IsActive
member.summary: Whether the CollisionManager autoamtically calls DoCollisions on this relationship every frame. If set to false, the CollisionManager will not call DoCollision, but DoCollision can be called manually to perform collision.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Math.Collision.CollisionRelationship.FrameSkip
member.summary: The number of frames to skip after performing collision logic. Default value is 0, which means no values are skipped.
member.remarks: A value of 1 will result in 1 frame being skipped after performing collisio logic resulting in collision being performed every other frame.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Math.Collision.CollisionRelationship.DoCollisions
member.summary: Performs the collision logic and returns whether a collision has occurred. This method does not need to be called if the CollisionRelationship is part of the CollisionManager and if its IsActive is set to true (both of which are the most common setup).
member.returns: Whether collisions occurred this frame.

member.name: F:FlatRedBall.Math.Collision.ListVsListLoopingMode.PreventDoubleChecksPerFrame
member.summary: When a list is colliding against itself, the indexes will be set such that if object A collides against object B, then object B will not also try to collide against object A in the same frame. This is desirable when performing collision between two objects with no subcollisions, or between two objects with the same subcollision.

member.name: F:FlatRedBall.Math.Collision.ListVsListLoopingMode.AllowDoubleChecksPerFrame
member.summary: When a list is colliding against itself, the indexes will be set such that if object A collides against object B, then object B will still attempt to collide against object A. This is desirable when performing collision between two objects with different subcollisions, such as a player weapon vs the player body.

member.name: F:FlatRedBall.Math.Collision.ListVsListRelationship`2.CollisionParameters.FirstHalfSize
member.summary: The half size (width or height) of the largest object in the first list. This should be the largest of X or Y, since this value is used for "secondary" partitioning too.

member.name: F:FlatRedBall.Math.Collision.ListVsListRelationship`2.CollisionParameters.SecondHalfSize
member.summary: The half size (width or height) of the largest object in the second list. This should be the largest of X or Y, since this value is used for "secondary" partitioning too.

member.name: T:FlatRedBall.Math.IAttachable
member.summary: Interface for an object which can be attached to a parent.
member.remarks: IAttachables do not necessarily have to be positioned objects - they can also be objects which have un-positioned attachments. For example, an event in a scripted sequence might have a parent event which it executes after.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Math.IAttachable.ListsBelongingTo
member.summary: Gets all lists that the instance belongs to.
member.remarks: This property provides the two-way relationship between IAttachables and and common FlatRedBall Lists.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Math.IAttachable.ClearRelationships
member.summary: Clears all attachments to parents and removes all attached Children.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Math.IAttachable.Detach
member.summary: Detaches the instance from its parent and removes it from its parent's Children List.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Math.IAttachable.ForceUpdateDependencies
member.summary: Forces an update of the instance and calls ForceUpdateDependencies on its parent.
member.remarks: This method will recursively crawl up the Parent property until it reaches the TopParent.

member.name: T:FlatRedBall.Math.IAttachableRemovable
member.summary: Interface defining that an object has a RemoveObject method. This standardizes the way that objects remove themselves from two-way lists.
member.remarks: This should not be implemented outside of the FlatRedBall Engine, but is public so that PositionedOjbect-inheriting objects can access the lists of objects that they belong to.

member.name: T:FlatRedBall.Math.Paths.Path
member.summary: An object which can define paths using line, arc, and move to commands. Once a path is defined, it can return positions and tangents given a length. Paths are often used to define the movement of objects along a fixed path, such as moving platforms and flying enemies.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Math.Paths.Path.Clear
member.summary: Clears all contained segments, resets the TotalLength to 0, and sets the current X and Y values for the next segment to 0.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Math.Paths.Path.TangentAtLength(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Returns the tangent unit vector at the argument length. If the tangent cannot be calculated, then a unit vector pointing to the right will be returned (a unit vector at angle 0).
member.remarks: The tangent is calculated by looking slightly in front and slightly behind the path. Therefore, values near sharp corners, or paths with wavy paths may return incorrect values.
member.param: The location along the Path.
The amount of distance to look in front and behind. Values which are very wavy may require a smaller epsilon. Paths with very large values may require a larger epsilon.
member.returns: A tangent unit vector, or a unit vector pointing to the right if a tangent cannot be calculated.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Math.PositionedObjectList`1.GetFirstAfterPosition(System.Single,FlatRedBall.Math.Axis,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the first object found after the argument "value" on the argument "axis". Lists must be sorted for this method to work effectively. WARNING: This method uses an inclusive upper bound. Use GetFirstAfter instead which uses an exclusive upper bound.
member.param: The value to search after. For example, this method will return objects with their position values greater than the argument value. In other words, if 0 is passed as the value, then objects with position values greater than (not equal to) will be returned.
The axis representing the value to use (x, y, or z)
The lower (inclusive) bound.
The upper (inclusive) bound. This argument is why GetFirstAfterPosition is obsolete.
member.returns: The index of the first object after the given value.

member.remarks: This method is useful when searching for items in a list after a given value.
member.param: The value to search after. For example, this method will return objects with their position values greater than the argument value. In other words, if 0 is passed as the value, then objects with position values greater than (not equal to) will be returned.
The axis representing the value to use (x, y, or z)
The lower (inclusive) bound.
The upper (exclusive) bound.
member.returns: The index of the first object after the given value. If low bound equals high bound, then the low bound is returned.

member.summary: The estimated length of the spline, as determined by calling CalculateDistanceTimeRelationships. This value is not available until CalculateDistanceTimeRelationships is called. CalculateDistanceTimeRelationships must be called if the spline changes or else this value may not be accurate.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Math.Splines.Spline.CalculateVelocities
member.summary: Determines the velocity (tangent) of the spline through all points except the first and last point. The first and last point velocities will be unchanged, so they will default to 0 unless set manually.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Math.Splines.Spline.CalculateDistanceTimeRelationships(System.Single)
member.summary: Calculates the position along the spline given a time interval. The smaller the time interval, the smoother the spline. The larger the time interval, the faster CalculateDistanceTimeRelationships will execute and the less internal memory will be used to store points.
member.param: The time interval in seconds. For splines which have very sharp curves this value may need to be smaller to give a smoother curve. Trial and error may be required to get a smooth spline, but a value of 0.1 seconds is a good starting point.
