member.name: T:FlatRedBall.SpriteCustomBehavior
member.summary: Delegate for methods which can be assigned to the Sprite for every-frame custom logic or when a Sprite is removed.
member.param: The Sprite on which the logic should execute.

member.name: T:FlatRedBall.Sprite
member.summary: A visual element which can display an entire Texture2D, part of a Texture2D, or solid color.
member.remarks: Sprites are one of the most common objects used in FlatRedBall. They are typically used to visualize entities (player, enemies, bullets, power-ups). Sprites can also be used for particles and other standalone visuals which are not tied to entities. Sprites support a variety of features including velocity, acceleration, drag, rotation, attachment, AnimationChain animations, color operations, and scaling.

member.name: F:FlatRedBall.Sprite.IsBillboarded
member.summary: Whether the Sprite should be rotated to always face the camera. If true, the Sprite will always face the camera. This is typically only used in 3D games with a camera that can rotate.

member.name: F:FlatRedBall.Sprite.TolerateMissingAnimations
member.summary: Whether the Sprite code will tolerate (not throw exceptions) CurrentChainName assignments which do not exist in the code. Normally this is false. This is set to true in edit mode.

member.name: F:FlatRedBall.Sprite.mEmpty
member.summary: Used by particles to flag a particular Sprite as empty.
member.remarks: The SpriteManager is responsible for particle recycling and uses this value to indicate whether a Sprite is currently used. This should not be manually modified.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Sprite.Alpha
member.summary: Controls the Sprite's transparency. A value of 1 is fully opaque, a value of 0 is fully transprent.
member.remarks:
Alpha controls a Sprite's transparency. A completely opaque Sprite has an Alpha of 1 while a completely transparent object has an Alpha of 0.
Setting the AlphaRate of a completely opaque Sprite to -1 will make the sprite disappear in one second. Invisible Sprites continue to remain in memory and are managed by the SpriteManager. The Alpha variable will automatically regulate itself if the value is set to something outside of the 0 - 1 range.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Sprite.AlphaRate
member.summary: Sets the rate at which the Alpha property changes. This is in units per second. A fully opaque Sprite (Alpha = 1) will disappear in 1 second if its AlphaRate is set to -1.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Sprite.UpdateVertexColorsAccordingToAlpha
member.summary: Updates all vertex colors according to the current Alpha value considering the current ColorOperation.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Sprite.Red
member.summary: The red component of the color value to be used with the color operation. This value should be between 0 and 1.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Sprite.Green
member.summary: The green component of the color value to be used with the color operation. This value should be between 0 and 1.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Sprite.Blue
member.summary: The blue component of the color value to be used with the color operation. This value should be between 0 and 1.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Sprite.Texture
member.summary: The texture to be displayed by the Sprite.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Sprite.TextureScale
member.summary: The relationship between the displayed portion of the Sprite's texture and its Width/Height. If this value is less than or equal to 0, then Width and Height values are not set according to the displayed portion of the Sprite's texture. Otherwise, the displayed portion of the texture are multiplied by this value to determine the Sprite's Width and Height.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Sprite.FlipHorizontal
member.summary: Whether to flip the Sprite's texture on the y Axis (left and right switch).
member.remarks: This kind of texture rotation can be accomplished by simply rotating a Sprite on its yAxis; however, there are times when this is inconvenient or impossible due to attachment relationships. There is no efficiency consequence for using either method. If a Sprite is animated, this value will be overwritten by the AnimationChain being used.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Sprite.FlipVertical
member.summary: Whether to flip the Sprite's texture on the x Axis (top and bottom switch).
member.remarks: This kind of texture rotation can be accomplished by simply rotating a Sprite on its xAxis; however, there are times when this is inconvenient or impossible due to attachment relationships. There is no efficiency consequence for using either method. If a Sprite is animated, this value will be overwritten by the AnimationChain being used.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Sprite.TopTextureCoordinate
member.summary: The top coordinate in texture coordinates on the sprite. Default is 0. This value is in texture coordinates, not pixels. A value of 1 represents the bottom side of the texture.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Sprite.TopTexturePixel
member.summary: The top pixel displayed on the sprite. Default is 0. This value is in pixel coordinates, so it typically ranges from 0 to the height of the referenced texture.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Sprite.BottomTextureCoordinate
member.summary: The bottom coordinate in texture coordinates on the sprite. Default is 1. This value is in texture coordinates, not pixels. A value of 1 represents the bottom side of the texture.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Sprite.BottomTexturePixel
member.summary: The bottom pixel displayed on the sprite. Default is the height of the texture. This value is in pixel coordiantes, so it typically ranges from 0 to the height of the referenced texture.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Sprite.LeftTextureCoordinate
member.summary: The left coordinate in texture coordinates on the sprite. Default is 0. This value is in texture coordinates, not pixels. A value of 1 represents the right side of the texture.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Sprite.LeftTexturePixel
member.summary: The left pixel displayed on the sprite. Default is 0. This value is in pixel coordinates, so it typically ranges from 0 to the width of the referenced texture.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Sprite.RightTextureCoordinate
member.summary: The right coordinate in texture coordinates on the sprite. Default is 1. This value is in texture coordinates, not pixels. A value of 1 represents the right side of the texture.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Sprite.RightTexturePixel
member.summary: The right pixel displayed on the sprite. Default is the width of the texture. This value is in pixel coordinates, so it typically ranges from 0 to the width of the referenced texture.

member.name: F:FlatRedBall.Sprite.TextureAddressMode
member.summary: Controls how the Sprite's treats texture coordinates outside of the 0-1 normalized coordinates.

member.name: F:FlatRedBall.Sprite.TextureFilter
member.summary: Sets the forced texture filter for this sprite. By default this is null, and will use the GraphicsOptions TextureFilter.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Sprite.VerticesForDrawing
member.summary: Represents the four (4) vertices used to render the Sprite. This value is set if the Sprite is either a manuall updated Sprite, or if the SpriteManager's ManualUpdate method is called on this.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Sprite.AnimationSpeed
member.summary: Gets or sets the speed multiplier when playing animations. A value of 1 makes animations play at normal speed. A value of 2 will play animations twice as fast.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Sprite.CurrentChain
member.summary: Gets the current animationChain - retrieved through the CurrentChainIndex property. Setting this sets the CurrentChainName since rather than a direct reference. Therefore, this chain must be contained in the AnimationChains list.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Sprite.CurrentChainIndex
member.summary: Gets and sets the index of the current AnimationChain in the Sprite's AnimationChains list.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Sprite.CurrentChainName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the current animation chain on the sprite. Setting this value is the recommended way to switch between animations. Setting this value will search the Sprite's AnimationChains for an animation with a matching name. If the argument differs from the current animation, the animation is set and played from the beginning. If the current animation matches the assigned value, no changes are made.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Sprite.CurrentFrameIndex
member.summary: The frame currently displayed by the Sprite. Normally this frame will advance automatically as a Sprite plays an animation. Manually setting this value updates the Sprite's texture coordiantes and offsets.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Sprite.CurrentFrame
member.summary: The current AnimationFrame displayed by this Sprite, or null if no AnimationFrame is being displayed

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Sprite.JustChangedFrame
member.summary: Whether this Sprite just changed the AnimationFrame it is displaying due to internal animation activity this frame.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Sprite.JustCycled
member.summary: Whether this Sprite just cycled its animation (set its CurrentFrameIndex to 0) due to internal animation activity this frame.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Sprite.TimeIntoAnimation
member.summary: The number of seconds that have passed since the beginning of the animation. This is effectively the same as setting the CurrentFrameIndex, but allows controlling the position by time rather than by frame.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Sprite.ScaleX
member.summary: The distance from the center of the Sprite to its edge, which is equal to Width / 2.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Sprite.ScaleY
member.summary: The distance from the center of the Sprite to its edge, which is equal to Height / 2.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Sprite.Left
member.summary: Returns the left X of the Sprite, assuming no rotation.
member.remarks: If the sprite is rotated, this property will not return the correct value.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Sprite.Right
member.summary: Returns the right X of the sprite, assuming no rotation.
member.remarks: If the sprite is rotated, this property will not return the correct value.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Sprite.Top
member.summary: Returns the top Y of the sprite, assuming no rotation.
member.remarks: If the sprite is rotated, this property will not return the correct value.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Sprite.Bottom
member.summary: Returns the bottom Y of the sprite, assuming no rotation.
member.remarks: If the sprite is rotated, this property will not return the correct value.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Sprite.RelativeLeft
member.summary: Returns the left edge of the Sprite relative its Parent. This value uses RelativeX and Width/2 to calculate this value.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Sprite.RelativeRight
member.summary: Returns the right edge of the Sprite relative its Parent. This value uses RelativeX and Width/2 to calculate this value.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Sprite.RelativeTop
member.summary: Returns the top edge of the Sprite relative its Parent. This value uses RelativeY and Height/2 to calculate this value.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Sprite.RelativeBottom
member.summary: Returns the bottom edge of the Sprite relative its Parent. This value uses RelativeY and Height/2 to calculate this value.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Sprite.Width
member.summary: The Sprite's Width in absolute world coordinates. This value may be set according to the currently displayed texture and texture coordinates if TextureScale is greater than 0.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Sprite.Height
member.summary: The Sprite's Height in absolute world coordinates. This value may be set according to the currently displayed texture and texture coordinates if TextureScale is greater than 0.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Sprite.TimeCreated
member.summary: The time returned by the TimeManager when the Sprite was created.
member.remarks: This value is automatically set when the Sprite is added through the SpriteManager. If a Sprite is created manually (either as a Sprite or a class inheriting from the Sprite class) this value should be set manually if it is to be used later.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Sprite.Visible
member.summary: Controls the visibility of the Sprite
member.remarks: This variable controls the visiblity of the Sprite. Sprites are visible by default. Setting Visible to false will make the sprite invisible, but the Sprite will continue to behave regularly; custom behavior, movement, attachment, and animation are still executed, and collision is possible.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Sprite.SetScaleYRatioToX
member.summary: Sets the ScaleY so that the ScaleX/ScaleY ratio is the same as the source image used for the Sprite's texture.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Sprite.SetScaleXRatioToY
member.summary: Sets the ScaleY so that the ScaleX/ScaleY ratio is the same as the source image used for the Sprite's texture.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Sprite.TimedActivity(System.Single,System.Double,System.Single)
member.summary: Applies all velocities, rates, accelerations for real and relative values. If the Sprite is part of the SpriteManager (which is common) then this is automatically called.
member.param: The number of seocnds that have passed since last frame.
Precalculated (secondDifference * secondDifference)/2.0f for applying acceleration.
The number of seconds that passed last frame for calculating "real" values.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Sprite.UpdateToCurrentAnimationFrame
member.summary: Updates the sprite according to its current AnimationChain and AnimationFrame. Specifically this updates - Texture - Texture coordiantes - Flip Horizontal (if IgnoreAnimationChainTextureFlip is true) - Relative X and Y (if UseAnimationRelativePosition is true - Executes AnimationFrame instructions - Adjusts the size of the sprite if its TextureScale is greater than 0
member.remarks: This method is automatically called for sprites which are automatically updated (default) and which are using an AnimationChain. This can be manually called after assigning the AnimationFrame and AnimationChain.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Sprite.Clone
member.summary: Returns a clone of this instance.
member.remarks: Attachments are not cloned. The new clone will not have any parents or children.
member.returns: The new clone.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Sprite.AnimateSelf(System.Double)
member.summary: Performs the every-frame logic for updating the current AnimationFrame index. If the Sprite is part of the SpriteManager then this is automatically called.
member.param: The number of seconds that have passed since the game has started running.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Sprite.ClearAnimationChains
member.summary: Clears all references to AnimationChains and sets the Animate property to false.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Sprite.RemoveAnimationChain(FlatRedBall.Graphics.Animation.AnimationChain)
member.summary: Removes the AnimationChain from the Sprite's internal AnimationChain List.
member.remarks: If the chainToRemove is also the CurrentChain, the animate field is set to false.
member.param: The AnimationChain to remove.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Sprite.SetAnimationChain(FlatRedBall.Graphics.Animation.AnimationChain)
member.summary: Sets the argument chainToSet as the animationChain. If the argument chainToSet is not part of the Sprite's internal list of AnimationChains, it is added.
member.remarks:
This differs from FlatRedBall MDX - this method on FlatRedBall MDX does not add the argument AnimationChain to the Sprite's internal list.
This does not set any animation-related properties, but it does set the current texture to the current frame's texture. Therefore, it is still necessary to set Animate to true.
member.param: The AnimationChain to set as the current AnimationChain. This is added to the internal AnimationChains property if it is not already there.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Sprite.SetCollisionFromAnimation(FlatRedBall.Math.Geometry.ICollidable,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Updates the shapes in the argument ICollidable to match the shapes in the Sprite's current frame. If the Sprite does not have a frame, or if the frame does not have shapes, then this method makes no changes to the argument ICollidable.
member.param: The collidable to update.
Whether shapes that are part of the animation but not part of the collidable.Collision should be created and added.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Sprite.SetAnimationChain(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the current AnimationChain by name and keeps the CurrentFrame the same.
member.remarks:
This method assumes that the Sprite contains a reference to an AnimationChain with the name matching chainToSet. Passing a name that is not found in the Sprite's AnimationChainArray will not cause any changes.
This method will keep the CurrentFrame property the same (unless it exceeds the bounds of the new AnimationChain). In the case that the CurrentFrame is greater than the bounds of the new AnimationChain, the animation will cycle back to the beginning. The animate field is not changed to true if it is false.
member.param: The name of the AnimationChain to set as current.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.SpriteList.FindSpritesWithTexture(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.Texture2D)
member.summary: Returns a one-way SpriteList containing all Sprites in this SpriteList which reference the texture argument.
member.param: The texture to match against.
member.returns: SpriteList containing Sprites with matching textures.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.SpriteList.SortTextureInsertion(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sorts a sub-array of the SpriteArray by their Texture.
member.param: Index of the first Sprite, inclusive.
Index of the last Sprite, exclusive.

member.name: T:FlatRedBall.Updater
member.summary: Contains logic for updating objects. This is used to separate updates into different threads

member.name: T:FlatRedBall.SpriteManager
member.summary: Static manager class which handles the management of Sprites, SpriteFrames, Cameras, and other PositionedObjects.

member.name: F:FlatRedBall.SpriteManager.mDrawableBatches
member.summary: Unlayered, sorted drawable batches

member.name: F:FlatRedBall.SpriteManager.mZBufferedDrawableBatches
member.summary: Unlayered, ZBuffered drawable batches

member.name: F:FlatRedBall.SpriteManager.mParticleSprites
member.summary: SpriteList filled with valid Sprites at the start of execution.
member.remarks: Particle Sprites are defined as Sprites which have a short lifespan and are created frequently. Common uses are smoke, bullets, and explosions.

member.name: F:FlatRedBall.SpriteManager.mTimedRemovalList
member.summary: List of particles which should be removed on a timer. This is internal, so it can only be used by emitters.
member.remarks: As of March 19, 2023 Emitters are not used very often. Therefore, this list is almost always empty. It will remain here for old games but it's unlikely new games will use this unless the FRB Emitter object gets revived.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.SpriteManager.AutomaticallyUpdatedSprites
member.summary: A read-only collection of Sprites which are automatically managed every frame.
member.remarks:
Sprites in this list have all of their behavioral properties applied automatically. Examples of these properties include Velocity, Acceleration, rotational velocity, and color rates. This manage requires overhead which can become a significant portion of frame time, so moving Sprites to be manually updated can improve performance.
Most methods which create Sprites will place the created Sprite in this list.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.SpriteManager.Camera
member.summary: Gets the default Camera.
member.remarks: If your application is only using one Camera, then this Camera can be used for all logic. This Camera is automatically created by the engine, so single-camera applications do not need to instantiate their own Camera.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.SpriteManager.Cameras
member.summary: The List of all Cameras used by FlatRedBall. Any Camera in this List is managed and renders according to its settings.
member.remarks: Adding a Camera to this list will result in the Camera being managed by the engine and rendered. There is no AddCamera method - simply adding the Camera to this list is sufficient for adding it to the engine.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.SpriteManager.DrawableBatches
member.summary: A read-only collection of IDrawableBatches.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.SpriteManager.AutoIncrementParticleCountValue
member.summary: When not set to 0 and the number of particles on screen exceed what is available, then the MaxParticleCount will be incremented by this amount. Otherwise, it will throw an out of particles exception.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.SpriteManager.SpriteFrames
member.summary: Read-only collection of SpriteFrames managed by the SpriteManager.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.SpriteManager.Layers
member.summary: A read-only, ordered list of layers. This does not contain camera-specific layers. Layers with a higher index will be drawn on top of layers with a lower index. Layers will appear in this list in the order that they are added.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.SpriteManager.TopLayer
member.summary: A layer which is drawn on top of all other layers. This is drawn on every camera, obeying the camera's DestinationRectangle.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.SpriteManager.UnderAllDrawnLayer
member.summary: A layer which is drawn underneath all other layers, and under unlayered objects. This is drawn on every camera, obeying the camera's DestinationRectangle.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.SpriteManager.OrderedSortType
member.summary: Gets and sets the sorting type used on Sprites, Text objects, and DrawableBatches in the world (not on layers). For sorting visual objects on layers, see the Layer's SortType property.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.SpriteManager.#cctor
member.summary: Creates a new SpriteManager.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.SpriteManager.AddLayer(FlatRedBall.Graphics.Layer)
member.summary: Adds the argument layer at the end of the Layer list (above all layers except the TopLayer).
member.param: The layer ot add.
member.exception: Throws InvalidOperationException if this is not called on the primary thread.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.SpriteManager.InsertLayer(FlatRedBall.Graphics.Layer,System.Int32)
member.summary: Inserts the argument layer at the argument index.
member.param: The layer to add.
The insertion index.
member.exception: Throws InvalidOperationException if this is not called on the primary thread.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.SpriteManager.AddLayer
member.summary: Creates a new layer, adds it to the internal Layer list on top of all other layers (except the TopLayer), and returns it.
member.returns: The newly-created Layer
member.exception: Throws InvalidOperationException if this is not called on the primary thread.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.SpriteManager.AddToLayer(FlatRedBall.Sprite,FlatRedBall.Graphics.Layer)
member.summary:
Adds the argument Sprite to the argument Layer. If the Sprite is not already managed by the SpriteManager, the Sprite will also be added to the internal list for management. This method can be called multiple times to add a single Sprite to multiple Layers. If the Sprite is unlayered, it will be moved to the argument Layer and only be drawn on the argument Layer.
If the layerToAddTo argument is null then the Sprite is added as a regular un-layered Sprite.
member.param: The Sprite to add.
The Layer to add to. If null, the Sprite will be added as an un-layered Sprite.
member.exception: Thrown if this is not called on the primary thread.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.SpriteManager.AddToLayer(FlatRedBall.Graphics.IDrawableBatch,FlatRedBall.Graphics.Layer)
member.summary: Adds the argument batchToAdd to the argument layerToAddTo. If layerToAddTo is null, then this is the same as calling AddDrawableBatch(batchToAdd). If batchToAdd has already been added to the SpriteManager as an un-layered IDrawableBatch, this method will remove the IDrawableBatch from the unlayered list, and add it to the layer (so it draws only one time). Calling this method multiple times with multiple layers, however, will result in batchToAdd being part of multiple layers.
member.param: The IDrawableBatch to add.
The layer to add to, which can be null.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.SpriteManager.AddParticleSprite(FlatRedBall.Graphics.Animation.AnimationChainList,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new particle sprite and adds it to the SpriteManager for management. The sprite will have its AnimationChains assigned to the argument animations property. This sprite is given a TextureScale of 1.
member.param: The animations to use by the new particle Sprite.
The name of the animation to show. This name must be contained in the argument animations.
member.returns: The newly-created Sprite.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.SpriteManager.AddManualParticleSprite(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.Texture2D)
member.summary: Returns a particle Sprite which is not managed internally by the engine. This is the most efficient type of Sprite in FlatRedBall because it is pooled and the engine does not internally update the sprite.
member.param: The texture to assign to the sprite.
member.returns: The sprite, which may be returned from a pool of sprites.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.SpriteManager.AddDrawableBatch(FlatRedBall.Graphics.IDrawableBatch)
member.summary: Adds the argument IDrawableBatch to the engine to be rendered in order of its Z value.
member.remarks: This method must be called on the main thread.
member.param: The IDrawableBatch to draw

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.SpriteManager.GetDuplicateMembership
member.summary: Returns the first object which is added twice to the SpriteManager, or null if none are found.
member.returns: The first duplicate object or null.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.SpriteManager.ConvertToManuallyUpdated(FlatRedBall.Sprite)
member.summary: Converts the argument Sprite from an anutomatically updated Sprite to a manually updated Sprite.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.SpriteManager.ConvertToAutomaticallyUpdated(FlatRedBall.Sprite)
member.summary: Converts the argument Sprite from a manually updated Sprite to an automatically updated Sprite.
member.param: The sprite to convert.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.SpriteManager.IsManaging(FlatRedBall.Sprite)
member.summary: Returns whether the SpriteManager is holding a reference to the argment sprite.
member.param: The sprite to check references for.
member.returns: Whether the argument Sprite is referenced by the SpriteManager.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.SpriteManager.MoveToBack(FlatRedBall.Graphics.Layer)
member.summary: Moves the argument layer to the back (to index 0), so that all other layers draw on top of the argument layer.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.SpriteManager.MoveToFront(FlatRedBall.Graphics.Layer)
member.summary: Moves the argument layer so it appears in front (drawn after) all other layers.
member.param: The layer to move.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.SpriteManager.MoveLayerAboveLayer(FlatRedBall.Graphics.Layer,FlatRedBall.Graphics.Layer)
member.summary: Reorders the argument layerToMove so that it is drawn immediately after the relativeTo layer.
member.param: Which layer to move.
The layer to move in front of.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.SpriteManager.RemoveSpriteOneWay(FlatRedBall.Sprite)
member.summary: Removes the argument sprite from all SpriteManager lists and all layers, but keeps the Sprite attached to its parent objects (such as a Glue entity).
member.param: The Sprite to remove

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.SpriteManager.RemovePositionedObject(FlatRedBall.PositionedObject)
member.summary: Removes the argument objectToRemove from all SpriteManager lists (for rendering and automatic updates) as well as from any two-way lists that the object may belong to (such as PositionedObjectLists in custom code and lists in Glue).
member.param: The object to remove.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.SpriteManager.RemoveDrawableBatch(FlatRedBall.Graphics.IDrawableBatch)
member.summary: Removes the argument DrawableBatch from the internal list and calls its Destroy method.
member.param: The DrawableBatch to remove.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.SpriteManager.RemoveSpritePreserveRelationships(FlatRedBall.Sprite)
member.summary: Removes the Sprite from the SpriteManager but preserves emitters, attachment and children references.
member.remarks: Although the removed Sprite will preserve its parent and children, the parent will no longer see this Sprite as its child, and the children will no longer see this Sprite as their parent. The preservation of relationships is not a functional one. Usually this method is used to keep relationships alive on a removed Sprite for reattachment at a later time.
member.param: The Sprite to remove.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.SpriteManager.ReplaceTexture(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.Texture2D,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.Texture2D)
member.summary: Finds all contained Sprites which reference the argument oldTexture and replaces the reference with newTexture.
member.remarks: This method will preserve all sizes of Sprites even if they use a non-zero PixelSize.
member.param: The old Texture2D to replace.
The new Texture2D to use as a replacement.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.SpriteManager.UpdateDependencies
member.summary: Updates the dependencies of all contained automatically updated Sprites, Cameras, and SpriteFrames.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.SpriteManager.CreateParticleSprite(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.Texture2D)
member.summary: Returns a new Sprite instance from the particle pool, but does not add it to the SpriteManager.
member.param: The texture to assign on the sprite.
member.returns: The new sprite.

member.name: T:FlatRedBall.TimeMeasurementUnit
member.summary: Represents the unit of time measurement. This can be used in files that store timing information.

member.name: T:FlatRedBall.TimeManager
member.summary: Class providing timing information for the current frame, absolute time since the game has started running, and for the current screen.

member.name: F:FlatRedBall.TimeManager.CurrentTime
member.summary: The amount of time in seconds since the game started running. This value is updated once-per-frame so it will always be the same value until the next frame is called. This value does not consider pausing. To consider pausing, see CurrentScreenTime.
member.remarks: This value can be used to uniquely identify a frame.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.TimeManager.SecondDifference
member.summary: The number of seconds (usually a fraction of a second) since the last frame. This value can be used for time-based movement. This value is changed once per frame, and will remain constant within each frame, assuming a consant TimeFactor. Changing the TimeFactor adjusts this value.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.TimeManager.TimeFactor
member.summary: A multiplier for how fast time runs. This is 1 by default. Setting this value to 2 will make everything run twice as fast. Increasing this value effectively increases the SecondDifference value, so custom code which is time-based will behave properly when TimeFactor is adjusted.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.TimeManager.CurrentScreenTime
member.summary: Returns the amount of time since the current screen started. This value does not advance when the screen is paused.
member.remarks: This value is the same as Screens.ScreenManager.CurrentScreen.PauseAdjustedCurrentTime

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.TimeManager.Initialize
member.summary: Allows the game component to perform any initialization it needs to before starting to run. This is where it can query for any required services and load content.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.TimeManager.StartSumTiming
member.summary: Begins Sum Timing

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.TimeManager.TimeSection
member.summary: Stores an unnamed timed section.
member.remarks: A timed section is the amount of time (in seconds) since the last time either Update or TimeSection has been called. The sections are reset every time Update is called. The sections can be retrieved through the GetTimedSections method.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.TimeManager.TimeSection(System.String)
member.summary: Stores an named timed section.
member.remarks: A timed section is the amount of time (in seconds) since the last time either Update or TimeSection has been called. The sections are reset every time Update is called. The sections can be retrieved through the GetTimedSections method.
member.param: The label for the timed section.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.TimeManager.SecondsSince(System.Double)
member.summary: Returns the number of seconds which have passed since the argument value in game time. This value continues to increment when the screen is paused, and does not reset when switching screens. Usually game logic should use CurrentScreenSecondsSince.
member.remarks: This value will only change once per frame, so it can be called multiple times per frame and the same value will be returned, assuming the same parameter is passed.
member.param: The amount of time since the start of the game.
member.returns: The number of seconds which have passed in absolute time since the start of the game.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.TimeManager.CurrentScreenSecondsSince(System.Double)
member.summary: Returns the number of seconds that have passed since the argument value. The return value will not increase when the screen is paused, so it can be used to determine how much game time has passed for event which should occur on a timer.
member.param: The time value, probably obtained earlier by calling CurrentScreenTime
member.returns: The number of unpaused seconds that have passed since the argument time.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.TimeManager.Delay(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Returns a task which completes after the argument timespan has passed in screen time. This considers slow-motion and pausing.
member.param: The amount of time to wait.
member.returns: A task which will complete when the arugment time passes.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.TimeManager.DelaySeconds(System.Double)
member.summary: Returns a task which completes after the argument seconds have passed in screen time. This considers slow-motion and pausing.
member.param: The number of seconds to wait.
member.returns: The task which will complete when the argument time passes.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.TimeManager.DelayUntil(System.Func{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Returns a task which completes once the argument predicate is fulfilled. This is checked once per frame.
member.param: The predicate to check for completion.
member.returns: The task which will complete when the predicate returns true.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.TimeManager.DelayFrames(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a task which completes after the argument number of frames have passed.
member.param: The number of frames to wait.

member.param: The float to convert.
The number of decimals after the point. For example, 3.14159 becomes "3.14" if the decimalsAfterPoint is 2. This method will not append extra decimals to reach the argument decimalsAfterPoint.
member.returns: The string representation of the argument float.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Utilities.StringFunctions.GetCharAfter(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Returns the character that can be found after a particular sequence of characters.
member.remarks: This will return the first character following a particular sequence of characters. For example, GetCharAfter("bcd", "abcdef") would return 'e'.
member.param: The string to search for.
The string to search in.
member.returns: Returns the character found or the null character '\0' if the string is not found.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Utilities.StringFunctions.GetFloatAfter(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Returns the float that can be found after a particular sequence of characters.
member.remarks: This will return the float following a particular sequence of characters. For example, GetCharAfter("height = 6; width = 3; depth = 7;", "width = ") would return 3.0f.
member.param: The string to search for.
The string to search in.
member.returns: Returns the float value found or float.NaN if the string is not found.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Utilities.StringFunctions.GetIntAfter(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Returns the first integer found after the argument stringToSearchFor in whereToSearch.
member.remarks: This method is used to help simplify parsing of text files and data strings. If stringToSearchFor is "Y:" and whereToSearch is "X: 30, Y:32", then the value of 32 will be returned.
member.param: The string pattern to search for.
The string that will be searched.
member.returns: The integer value found after the argument stringToSearchFor.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Utilities.StringFunctions.GetIntAfter(System.String,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the first integer found after the argument stringToSearchFor. The search begins at the argument startIndex.
member.param: The string pattern to search for.
The string that will be searched.
The index to begin searching at. This method will ignore any instances of stringToSearchFor which begin at an index smaller than the argument startIndex.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Utilities.StringFunctions.GetLineCount(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the number of lines in a given string. Newlines '\n' increase the line count.
member.param: The string that will have its lines counted.
member.returns: The number of lines in the argument. "Hello" will return a value of 1, "Hello\nthere" will return a value of 2.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Utilities.StringFunctions.GetNumberAtEnd(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the number found at the end of the argument stringToGetNumberFrom or throws an ArgumentException if no number is found.
member.remarks: A stringToGetNumberFrom of "sprite41" will result in the value of 41 returned. A stringToGetNumberFrom of "sprite" will result in an ArgumentException being thrown.
member.exception: Throws ArgumentException if no number is found at the end of the argument string.
member.param: The number found at the end.
member.returns: The integer value found at the end of the stringToGetNumberFrom.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Utilities.StringFunctions.IncrementNumberAtEnd(System.String)
member.summary: Increments the number at the end of a string or adds a number if none exists.
member.remarks: This method begins looking at the end of a string for numbers and moves towards the beginning of the string until it encounters a character which is not a numerical digit or the beginning of the string. "Sprite123" would return "Sprite124", and "MyString" would return "MyString1".
member.param: The string to "increment".
member.returns: Returns a string with the number at the end incremented, or with a number added on the end if none existed before.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Utilities.StringFunctions.InsertSpacesInCamelCaseString(System.String)

member.remarks: For example "HelloThereIAmCamelCase" becomes "Hello There I Am Camel Case".
member.param: The string in which to insert spaces.
member.returns: The string with spaces inserted.
